link.synopsis: When three slackers in need of gainful employment somehow stumble into jobs with the Atlanta Police Department, they're thrown into the fire and expected to keep the peace. But these unskilled rookies are hardly equipped to deal with the likes of petty thieves and diamond smugglers who've made crime their life. Dwayne Carl, David Vallin and Jevocas Green co-star in this urban comedy of hilarious proportions.
link.title: synopsis
Kathy Griffin: My Life on the D-List
The Dukes of Hazzard: The Beginning
The Longshot / They Went That-A-Way & That-A-Way

link.synopsis: When a recently divorced man (Eduard Fernández) and a single mother of two (Ana Belén) discover in each other a second chance at love, high jinks ensue, as old flames and family ties converge to complicate the fledgling romance. Director Manuel Gómez Pereira's wry comedy takes a satirical look at the thorny tangles of modern relationships and the calamity we're willing to endure in the name of love.
link.title: synopsis
Dios te Bendiga Hijo Mío: Santa Martha Acatitla Penitenciaria
No Dejare Que No Me Quieras

link.synopsis: A close-knit yet unusual family -- headed by an irresponsible bohemian father (Antonio Resines) and a devoted mother (Verónica Forqué) -- embarks on an unforgettable summer in an Ibiza beach house in 1970 and finds each of their lives thrown for a loop. Co-written and directed by filmmaker Manuel Iborra, this heartwarming comedy is a hilarious portrait of a family in the midst of sweeping cultural change.
link.title: synopsis
Schoolgirl Report: Vol. 6: What Parents Would Gladly Hush Up
De Que Se Rien Las Mujeres?
The Other Side of the Bed
What Have I Done to Deserve This?

link.synopsis: Based on a true story, this action-packed comedy follows four overworked Colombian soldiers who stumble upon $46 million while on a rescue mission in the jungle and decide to keep the cash for themselves rather than turn it in to the government. With their only route home destroyed by rebels, the soldiers work feverishly to get back to civilization so they can take advantage of their newfound fortune.
link.title: synopsis
Dios los Junta y Ellos Se Separan
Love in the Time of Cholera
Si Honraras a Tu Coca Madre
La Muerte del Gallo de Oro
1888: El Extraordinario Viaje de la Santa Isabel

link.synopsis: Just as their father kicks them out of the house, slacker brothers Chuttan and Puttan fall in love with beautiful Shaila and Poonam. Desperate to prove their love despite their lack of resources, they plan an elaborate ruse to fake Puttan's murder. But when Puttan really disappears and a body turns up, Chuttan runs out of ideas. Vinod Mehra, Mehmood, Aruna Irani and Ashok Kumar star in this madcap classic comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Sandeep and his servant Sevak make their first trip to the small village of Shikarpur on business and are perplexed when everyone there seems to know them. By astounding coincidence, both men have twins, also named Sandeep and Sevak, in Shikarpur. Fate conspires to put each set of twins in the wrong place at the wrong time, resulting in hilarious confusion. Kishore Kumar and Asit Sen star in Debu Sen's uproarious comedy of mistaken identity.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: For John Lennon (Justin Ipock) and David Mayhews (Kelly Fisher), turning 30 requires more change than either expected. Living in cyberspace, John realizes that real love and life are passing him by. And David's dream of rock stardom may have to yield to the 9-to-5 grind. But growing up doesn't necessarily mean growing old. Rollence Patugan, Lee Whittaker, April Wade and Sarah Andrews star in this touching comedy directed by Peter Bruno.
link.title: synopsis
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home

link.synopsis: Hoping to craft the winning entry in a student film competition, teenage movie geek Cameron (Michael Angarano) enlists the help of an ornery old Hollywood gaffer named Flash (Christopher Plummer), who happens to be the last surviving crew member of Orson Welles's masterpiece Citizen Kane. Written and directed by Michael Shroeder, this unusual comedy also stars Robert Wagner as a has-been producer and M. Emmet Walsh as a retired screenwriter.
link.title: synopsis
Divine Secrets of the Ya-Ya Sisterhood
A Love Song for Bobby Long
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School

link.synopsis: Social misfit and self-labeled "troll from under the bridge" Keith Sontag (Dore Mann) lives a sad and lonely existence in this disturbing black comedy -- an Independent Spirit Award nominee -- from director Ronald Bronstein. When he's not trying to sell coupons door-to-door, Keith struggles with evicting his roommate from their seedy apartment, helping a friend who's suicidal and just getting by as an outsider in the cruel city.
link.title: synopsis
Six Sex Scenes and a Murder
The 2005 Academy Award Short Films Collection
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: Lovable loser Curtis Prentiss (Billy Crudup) enlists the help of his friend Kenny (David Hornsby) and ornery scientist Rick (Paul Giamatti) to build a rocket belt, which Curtis firmly believes will make him famous. But the partners soon learn that business and friendship don't mix. Too much ambition can be a dangerous thing, especially when it leads to murder, kidnapping and prison. This dark comedy marks actor Paul Schneider's directorial debut.
link.title: synopsis
What If God Were the Sun?
Assassination of a High School President
The Saddest Music in the World

link.synopsis: Crime definitely does not pay for the characters of this cool comedy, which features a rogue's gallery of hapless crooks and old scoundrels. Whether trying to rob a roadside diner or kidnap a wealthy man's daughter, these hoods are totally inept. With a nod to both American and French films, this humorous look at the lighter side of crime employs and subverts classic thriller conventions. Jean Rochefort, Sergi López and Anna Mouglalis star.
link.title: synopsis
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
How Much Do You Love Me?
In the Arms of My Enemy

title.regular: I Always Wanted to Be a Gangster
title.short: I Always Wanted to Be a Gangster

link.synopsis: Fleeing her high-stress lifestyle, Taeko (Satomi Kobayashi) hops a flight to a remote island, where, at first, she thinks the natives are completely crazy. Soon, however, she begins to see their charm and learns to go with the flow. Set in Japan, this fun comedy is populated with endearing characters who colorfully underscore the importance of taking time to really enjoy life.
link.title: synopsis
When the Last Sword Is Drawn
Vermilion Pleasure Night: Vol. 1: Optic Erotica
Attack Girls' Swim Team vs. the Undead

link.synopsis: Suffering from a neurological disorder that causes him to periodically enter a trancelike state, sheltered teen Samuel (Juan José Ballesta) has difficulty forging connections with people. But when he unexpectedly winds up in Madrid, his life takes a surprising turn. He meets a quirky young woman, Consuelo (Adriana Ugarte), and the two form an unusual relationship in this offbeat Spanish comedy from writer-director Santi Amodeo.
link.title: synopsis
Tu Que Harias Por Amor: Just Run!
The Other Side of the Bed
Todas Las Azafatas Van Al Cielo

link.synopsis: To get out of a ticket, television writer Miguel (Mauricio Isaac) gives away a secret about his hit series to a police officer. But the boastful cop, Bracho (Dagoberto Gama), feels humiliated in front of his friends when he discovers the information is false -- and vows revenge. As Bracho's fury grows, so does his appetite for violence in this surreal Mexican comedy directed by Sergio Umansky.
link.title: synopsis
Juan, I Forgot I Don't Remember
Donde Quedo La Abuela? El Viaje De La Nonna

title.regular: It's Better if Gabriela Doesn't Die
title.short: It's Better if Gabriela Doesn't Die

link.synopsis: After they're accidentally dropped on a remote Australian beach rather than an area near Perth as intended, a trio of Iraqi and Cambodian refugees find themselves wandering through a vast desert in this black comedy. Unlikely companions Yousif Al-Samer (Rodney Afif), Arun (Kenneth Moraleda) and Ramelan (Sri Sacdpraseuth) band together to find their way out of the outback … without a map and with only one bottle of water.
link.title: synopsis
If It's Tuesday, It Still Must be Belgium
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins
Katt Williams: American Hustle: The Movie
Ryan and Sean's Not So Excellent Adventure
Benny Bliss & the Disciples of Greatness
I Hope They Serve Beer in Hell
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle
Basic Black: The Lewis Black Story

link.synopsis: When they hear he's due to appear at a Utah screening, Western actors Mel Torres (Del Zamora) and Fred Fletcher (Ed Pansullo) concoct a plan for revenge on screenwriter Fritz Frobisher, who terrorized them years ago when they were child extras on a movie set. They set off on a road trip to Monument Valley -- the site of John Ford's celebrated classics -- with a plan to confront their nemesis in this offbeat comedy from Alex Cox (Repo Man).
link.title: synopsis
My Wife Is a Gambling Maestro
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story

link.synopsis: Wheelchair-bound after an accident, paraplegic Geirr (Fridtjov Såheim) spends his days isolated and bitter. When his girlfriend (Kirsti Eline Torhaug) invites uber-positive National Health psychologist Tori (Kjersti Holmen) to their house to help, it sets the stage for an epic showdown between the two. Bård Breien directs this black comedy from Norway, which co-stars Henrik Mestad and Marian Saastad Ottesen.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: With his obsessive perfectionism, cafeteria manager Jan (Lars Brygmann) alienates his co-workers on the ferryboat where he works, and his relationship with his violent and bitter wife (Sidse Babett Knudsen) is even worse. But things change when he joins a spousal abuse therapy group. Jan's new friendships with wife-beaters Rudy (Nicolaj Kopernikus) and Alf (Rasmus Bjerg) lead him down an unexpected path in this black comedy from Denmark.
link.title: synopsis
Pusher 3: I'm the Angel of Death
Pusher 2: With Blood on My Hands

link.synopsis: Ram (Kamal Hassan), a married airline pilot with a history of infidelity, falls into a drunken depression after his wife leaves him. His pals try to raise his spirits by arranging a tryst with a dancer, but Ram realizes he loves his wife and walks out on the girl. Things take an unexpected turn when he and his pals return to her hotel room and discover her in a pool of blood. Now, they must try to hide her body in this black comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Kal Ho Naa Ho: Tomorrow May Never Come

link.synopsis: There's only one thing brothers Stone (Ian Reed Kesler) and Ed (Travis Wester) love as much as marijuana, and that's each other. So when they find out they might not be related, they set out on a quest to locate Stone's mother. Along the way, the guys get caught up in a war between Mexican drug lords and CIA operatives, encounter a blond bombshell in handcuffs and run into an assortment of wacky characters in this comedy from Adam Meyerowitz.
link.title: synopsis
I Got Five on It Too
National Lampoon Presents: One, Two, Many
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back

link.synopsis: Sharing a child and a former marriage, Julia (Jenny McCarthy) and Jack (Matt Keeslar) remain madly in love; too bad they don't know it. What they need is a little divine intervention -- and they may just get it. When Jack's golf ball knocks an elderly man (Gene Bicknell) unconscious, the amnesiac who awakens seems to work miracles on everyone he encounters. But will his magic extend to Jack and Julia in this romantic comedy?
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Writer-director Neil Mandt's indie road movie follows lifelong buddies Charlie (Mandt) and Cliff (Marc Carter) as they embark on an outrageous globe-hopping journey to scatter the ashes of their friend Paul from one end of the world to the other. Choosing a loose, cinema vérité style, Mandt eschewed convention in shooting the comedy, working without a script or production schedule and capturing true spontaneity through improvised performance.
link.title: synopsis
Kathy Griffin: My Life on the D-List
Search and Rescue / River of Rage

link.synopsis: Master performer Jackie Gleason ruled 1950s TV comedy with his beloved and influential "The Jackie Gleason Show"; the Great One's comic legacy is explored in this documentary, which includes a special appearance by Gleason's wife, Marilyn. With keen commentary by host Jeff Garlin, the program collects various classic sketches featuring such characters as playboy Reggie Van Gleason, Rudy the Repairman, bus-driving dreamer Ralph Kramden and more.
link.title: synopsis
The Very Best of the Honeymooners
The Life & Death of Peter Sellers
Red Files: Secrets of the Russian Archives
Agile, Mobile, Hostile: A Year with Andre Williams
Young & Handsome: An Evening with Jeff Garlin
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Commercial Parodies
Beer: The Movie 2: Leaving Long Island
Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip: The Complete Series
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Jimmy Fallon
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Dan Aykroyd
Saturday Night Live: The Best of John Belushi
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 3
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Amy Poehler
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Tom Hanks
The Carol Burnett Show: Show Stoppers

link.synopsis: After suffering a humiliating defeat on the field, the members of a working-class soccer team believe all hope is lost. But when the mysterious Walter Keegan (Brendan Gleeson) offers to coach them, things start to look up. The new coach is a fierce disciplinarian who drills the out-of-shape players mercilessly, pushing them toward sharpening their skills … and maybe even winning a game. David Wilmot co-stars in this winning Irish comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The 2005 Academy Award Short Films Collection
St. Martin's Lane / Wings of the Morning: Double Feature
El Penalti Mas Largo Del Mundo
David Beckham: Life of an Icon

link.synopsis: Three buddies think they've found party paradise when they land a great deal on a Hollywood Hills mansion. They've been warned that the home has a gruesome history, but really, they insist, what's the worst that could happen? Well, for one, the residence they hoped would be a babe magnet turns out to be an evil magnet -- an actual portal to hell. Nightmare on Elm Street star Robert Englund directs this horror comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Hell House: The Book of Samiel
Blood Feast 2: All U Can Eat
Exorcism: The Possession of Gail Bowers
J-ok'el: La Llorona: Curse of the Weeping Woman

link.synopsis: When an evil organization begins killing fashion models to try to bring down the silk industry, the government calls upon "Mistress of the Martial Arts" Awesome Lotus (Lorraine Masterson) to solve the case. By her side is right-hand man Tofu Caca (Peter Schuyler), a blind, deaf-mute martial arts expert with a penchant for opera singing. David O'Malley's over-the-top action comedy has more than its fair share of gratuitous skin and violence.
link.title: synopsis
Surge of Power: The Stuff of Heroes
The Man with One Red Shoe
Who Framed Roger Rabbit?: Special Edition

link.synopsis: The great Jackie Gleason and Art Carney reprise their roles as Ralph Kramden and sidekick Ed Norton in this incarnation of "The Jackie Gleason Show," which aired on CBS in the late 1960s. Sheila MacRae and Jane Kean take over the roles of Alice and Trixie, and special guests appear in this fun mix of comedy series and variety show. Other regulars include the June Taylor Dancers, Sammy Spear and his Orchestra and announcer Johnny Olson.
link.title: synopsis
Sgt. Bilko: The Phil Silvers Show: Season 1
The Jack Benny Show: Collector's Edition
Bobby Vinton: Live: Songs From My Heart
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: My Little Chickadee
Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour: The Best of Season 2
The Carol Burnett Show: Let's Bump Up the Lights!
The I Love Lucy 50th Anniversary Special
I Love Lucy: Lucy's Really Lost Moments
The Very Best of the Honeymooners
My Favorite Martian: Time Travelers Favorites
The George Burns & Gracie Allen Show

link.synopsis: Laugh along with six episodes from one of Indian television's biggest comedy hits. Ranjit (Shafi Inamdar) and Renu (Swaroop Sampat) try to keep their marriage afloat while coping with Renu's slacker brother Raja (Rakesh Bedi) and a variety of characters played by show regular Satish Shah. This collection includes the episodes "The Divorce," "The Sofa Cum Bed," "Renu as a Sales Girl," the two-part "The South Indian Marriage" and "Cancer."
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

link.synopsis: Laugh along with six episodes from one of Indian television's biggest comedy hits. Ranjit (Shafi Inamdar) and Renu (Swaroop Sampat) try to keep their marriage afloat while coping with Renu's slacker brother Raja (Rakesh Bedi) and a variety of characters played by show regular Satish Shah. This collection includes the episodes "Guess Who's Coming to Dinner?," "Raja Falls in Love" and the two-parters "Women's Liberation" and "Thief's Sweet Tooth."
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Laugh along with six episodes from one of Indian television's biggest comedy hits. Ranjit (Shafi Inamdar) and Renu (Swaroop Sampat) try to keep their marriage afloat while coping with Renu's slacker younger brother Raja (Rakesh Bedi) and a variety of characters played by show regular Satish Shah. This collection includes the episodes "Blackmail," the two-part "Pregnancy," "Raja as a Salesman," "Smugglers' Den" and "War of Uncles."
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Laugh along with six episodes from one of Indian television's biggest comedy hits. Ranjit (Shafi Inamdar) and Renu (Swaroop Sampat) try to keep their marriage afloat while coping with Renu's slacker brother Raja (Rakesh Bedi) and a variety of characters played by show regular Satish Shah. This collection includes the episodes "The Antique Gift," "Truth or Lies?," "Double Trouble," "Marital Rift," "The Cooking Range" and "New Member Arrives."
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this Bollywood comedy, good friends (but errant husbands) Sreeram (Rajendraprasad), Chandu (Sivaji) and Ram Babu (Brahmanandam) are about to get their comeuppance thanks to a damsel in distress. When the guys take a break from boozing and misbehavior to rescue a pretty woman (Rambha), they claim to be bachelors, and she promises to wed the one who impresses her most … but their wives have something else in mind.
link.title: synopsis
Sree Seetha Ramula Kalyanam Chutamu Raarandi

link.synopsis: Overwhelmed by the attention he receives from the women who come into his shop, beauty parlor owner Raghava (Srikanth) asks his assistant to tell everyone he's married. But the plan backfires when Raghava falls for one of the girls (Sindhu Tolani) who thinks he's taken. A comedy of errors ensues as the misunderstandings multiply, and it's up to Raghava's business partner, Subba Rao (Rajendra Prasad), to unite the two lovers.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Joined by best buddies, bitter rivals and sexy female classmates, troublemaker Jorgito (Jorge Ortiz de Pinedo) returns for another laugh-out-loud season of this hit Mexican comedy series that features the outrageous antics of adults dressing and acting like schoolchildren. Constantly struggling to keep the rowdy pupils in line, the classroom's two harried teachers are often forced to use their paddles to maintain order.
link.title: synopsis
Jennifer Lopez Presents: Como Ama Una Mujer
South Pacific: In Concert From Carnegie Hall
And Starring Pancho Villa as Himself
El Coronel No Tiene Quien Le Escriba
A Good Death Beats a Dull Life
Cuentos De Hadas Para Dormir Cocodrilos
Entre La Tarde y La Noche

link.synopsis: In fast-paced corporate India, four friends -- played by Vir Das, Dilip Tadeshwar, Indraneil Sengupta and Ray Irani -- have little time for love but plenty of time for one-night stands in this quirky romantic comedy. Despite their commitment phobia, however, the foursome (who meet regularly at a pub called Mumbai Salsa) soon find themselves embroiled in increasingly complicated relationships with a quartet of young ladies.
link.title: synopsis
Kal Ho Naa Ho: Tomorrow May Never Come

link.synopsis: A small-time English crook tries to move up in the underworld by attempting to take over a family-owned pub near the Irish coast. But his plans soon begin to crumble when the plucky locals refuse to accept his takeover bid lying down. Will life in this small town ever be the same again? Directed and co-written by Mike Scullion, this dark comedy features Larry Austin, Karl Argue, Kathy Ranheim, Jamie Belton and Shaun Elebert.
link.title: synopsis
Tarzan and His Mate / Tarzan Finds a Son!
The Art of Soccer with John Cleese

link.synopsis: When an Omaha, Neb., family piles into an RV and heads to the wilds of California for their dream vacation, nightmares soon ensue. One mishap after another befalls the out-of-their-element suburbanites, but they're determined to prevail -- and perhaps learn some lessons along the way in this National Lampoon-style comedy starring Dave Foley, Lea Thompson, Patricia Richardson and Vicki Lewis, and directed by Linda Voorhees.
link.title: synopsis
NFL Cheerleaders: Making the Squad: San Diego Chargers
Youssou N'Dour: I Bring What I Love
Journey to the Center of the Earth
Doctor Who: Planet of the Dead

link.synopsis: Ex-cop Narasimha (Mohanlal) hires a pair of best friends, Raj (Prashant Raj) and Heero (Ajay Devgan), to find and capture crime boss Babban (Amitabh Bachchan), the man who killed Narasimha's family. But while training to defeat Babban, the two young men get distracted by falling in love. This Bollywood crime comedy, which references world political affairs including the U.S. war in Iraq, is an adaptation of the classic Indian film Sholay.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: When Chuy (Pedro Infante) goes to the train station to pick up his fiancée, Felicidad (Consuelo Guerrero de Luna), he discovers that she's been corrupted by feminist ideas. Hoping to put her back on track, Chuy tries to teach his future wife that women belong at home and men are in charge. Co-writer Carlos Orellana stars in and directs this politically incorrect Mexican comedy that focuses on the age-old battle of the sexes.
link.title: synopsis
Coleccion Pedro Infante: Mexicanos al Grito de Guerra
Coleccion Pedro Infante: La Mujer Que Yo Perdi
Coleccion Pedro Infante: Las Islas Marias
Coleccion Pedro Infante: Ustedes Los Ricos
Coleccion Pedro Infante: Nosotros Los Pobres
Coleccion Pedro Infante: A Toda Maquina
Coleccion Pedro Infante: Los Tres Garcia
Coleccion Pedro Infante: Los Tres Huastecos
Coleccion Pedro Infante: Vuelven los Garcia
Coleccion Pedro Infante: ¿Que Te Ha Dado Esa Mujer?
Coleccion Pedro Infante: Pepe el Toro
New King James Version Bible: Signature Edition
Paul Rodriguez's Latin All-Stars of Comedy: Vol. 1
Coleccion Pedro Infante: Escándalo de Estrellas
Coleccion Pedro Infante: La Oveja Negra
Coleccion Pedro Infante: Dicen Que Soy Mujeriego

title.regular: Coleccion Pedro Infante: Arriba las Mujeres

link.synopsis: Director John Banovich's riotous family comedy chronicles the farcical misadventures of hapless video-store clerk Albert (Adam Gregory) and his dimwitted co-worker buddies, George (Sean O. Roberts) and Ernie (Simeon Taole). When Albert's dream girl walks into the workplace, he enlists the help of his two moronic pals to attract her attention. Elizabeth Thai, Michael Roberds and Samantha McLeod also star.
link.title: synopsis
American Pie Presents: The Book of Love

link.synopsis: After his engagement is called off, Nick Jenkins (Austin Peck) finds himself thrust back into the dating world in this smart indie comedy. With help from his roommate and best friend, Jed Rollins (Stefan Marc), Nick braves the sometimes scary and often confusing singles scene. Soon, he's torn between continuing to have fun as a player or settling down. Leslie Bega, Rick Scarry and Stephanie Brown co-star.
link.title: synopsis
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human

link.synopsis: Jackie Gleason stars as New Jersey caterer Walter Hollander, whose vacation to Europe goes haywire after his family's plane is hijacked to Vulgaria and he's mistaken for an international agent in this screwball comedy based on a Woody Allen play. With Vulgarian spies on their trail, the Hollanders take refuge in the American embassy and must disguise themselves as Arab diplomats to sneak out of the country.
link.title: synopsis
The Russians Are Coming, The Russians Are Coming
It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World
Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines
Harlan: In the Shadow of Jew Süss
If It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgium
What Did You Do in the War, Daddy?
Tony Orlando & Dawn: The Ultimate Collection

link.synopsis: Set during World War II, director Ken Annakin's mordant British comedy stars James Robertson Justice as a cantankerous, conceited scientist who's incarcerated after his plane is shot down in enemy territory. When his fellow prisoners discover that his radar invention is of strategic importance, they conspire to help him escape at all costs. The supporting cast includes Leslie Phillips, Stanley Baxter and Eric Sykes.
link.title: synopsis
Kavanagh Q.C.: Nothing But the Truth
King and Country / Angels One Five
Unseen Cinema: Early American Avant-Garde Film 1894-1941
Are You Being Served? Again: The Complete Series
The Land Unknown / The Deadly Mantis
The Wrong Arm of the Law
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series
The Knack...and How to Get It
Don't Worry, We'll Think of a Title
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines

link.synopsis: Pushed by his mother, high school senior Peter (Topher Hopkins) works as a grocery clerk and a paperboy to earn money for college. But when sultry Sally (Darlene Demko) invites the sexually inexperienced Peter over for some unwholesome fun, school is the last thing on his mind. Sally and her friend Randy (Rene Orobello) introduce Peter to a kinky world he can't get enough of in this raunchy teen sex comedy.
link.title: synopsis
South Beach Academy / Rock 'n' Roll High School Forever
She Likes Girls 4: Tomboys & Tough Girls
House Party 4: Down to the Last Minute

link.synopsis: After surviving a near-fatal bus accident, four women vow to stay friends forever. When one of them, Res (Candy Pangilinan), is killed by her Hong Kong employer, the other women take her body back to the Philippines and pretend she's still alive. After all, if Res's husband were to find out that his wife was dead, there's no telling what he might do. Rufa Mae Quinto, Eugene Domingo and Pokwang also star in this Filipino comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote
Enteng Kabisote 3: Okay Ka Fairy Ko
All About Love: Ang Sarap Ma-In Love

link.synopsis: Cult filmmaker Katsuhito Ishii collaborates with former schoolmates Shunichiro Miki and Hajime Ishimine to create this absurd anthology of mind-bending short films. Centered on a trio of oddball brothers, this hyperimaginative experience blends comedy, science fiction and experimentalism to reach new cinematic heights. Rinko Kikuchi (Babel) stars alongside Susumu Terajima, Andrew Alfieri and Tadanobu Asano.
link.title: synopsis
Never Sleep Again: The Elm Street Legacy
The Last Days of the World
Vermilion Pleasure Night: Vol. 1: Optic Erotica
The Glamorous Life of Sachiko Hanai

link.synopsis: When the neighborhood hottie, DeDe (Racquia West), gets dumped by her beau (Tyrell Ellis), all the guys line up for a chance to win her heart in this laugh-out-loud urban comedy directed by Crystal Burdette. Does the local dweeb (Jah Shams) -- who wears his grandmother's sweaters and holds his glasses together with tape -- stand a chance? The supporting cast includes Taetta Chip and Tianah Patterson.
link.title: synopsis
My Big Phat Hip Hop Family
Black Woman's Guide to Finding a Good Man
Keepin' the Faith: Lookin' for Mr. Right
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself
Black Woman's Guide to Getting Married
I Think I Love My Wife

link.synopsis: This satirical comedy weaves vintage military training films and footage from World War II movies with a modern-day story about Major Nick Reed (Patrick Muldoon), whose mission to find a hidden enemy base is hampered when he runs into his ex-lover and her new man. Assigned to track down the Ghost Squadron, the Army Intelligence analyst is sidetracked by Lt. Monica Tasty (Elizabeth Ann Bennett) and her boyfriend, Major Dunning (Mackenzie Astin).
link.title: synopsis
Pauly Shore's Natural Born Komics Sketch Comedy Movie: Miami
Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human
Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
Meet the Spartans: Unrated Pit of Death Edition
The Men Who Stare at Goats
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

link.synopsis: "Designing Women" architect Linda Bloodworth-Thomason is the creative force behind this HBO series starring Lily Tomlin as the matriarch of a filthy-rich Texas brood whose excessive wealth only complicates their relationships and personal lives. Set in Dallas, the one-hour comedy also stars Mary Kay Place (who plays Tomlin's sister), Leslie Jordan (who plays a cousin) and "Deadwood" cast mates Sean Bridgers and Kim Dickens
link.title: synopsis
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
The Vicar of Dibley: 10th Anniversary Specials
The Funny World of Lucy: Vol. 2
The Best of Comedy Central Presents
The Best of the Colbert Report
Futurama the Movie: Bender's Big Score
America's Funniest Home Videos: Guide to Parenting
America's Funniest Home Videos: Motherhood Madness
America's Funniest Home Videos: Salute to Romance
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Cheri Oteri
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Saturday TV Funhouse
Futurama: The Beast with a Billion Backs
Saturday Night Live: The Best of '06/'07
The Red Green Story: We're All in this Together
Extras: The Extra Special Series Finale
To the Manor Born: Silver Wedding Anniversary
Keeping Up Appearances: Life Lessons from Onslow
The Life and Times of Vivienne Vyle
The Minor Accomplishments of Jackie Woodman: Season 1

link.synopsis: After the engagement ring he planned to give to his girlfriend, Emma (Ashleigh Ogden), is stolen, Mike (Ketzal Sterling) enlists his four best buddies for a high-powered mission to retrieve the ring in this black comedy from New Zealand. Delving into the underbelly of Auckland, the blokes don't hesitate to leave a trail of dead bodies in their wake. Sterling also wrote and directed the indie film, which takes place in real time.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Robert Dayton stars in this low-budget comedy as Andrew, a recently divorced eccentric who turns to boilerplate seduction techniques and self-deluding affirmations in order to make his way in the cutthroat dating scene. Written and directed by Blaine Thurier (director of Low Self-Esteem Girl and keyboardist for the band the New Pornographers), this quirky portrait of the perils of single life also stars Bonnie Catterson and Monica Chattaway.
link.title: synopsis
The Prize Winner of Defiance, Ohio
Me and You and Everyone We Know
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys

link.synopsis: Packed with Shemp Howard features, this treasure trove contains five 1930s solo shorts, three short films from the Three Stooges years, a clip from television's "Camel Comedy Caravan" with his cohorts Larry and Moe, and more. Interviews with Shemp's family members -- including his daughter-in-law and granddaughter -- shed light on this great entertainer. Previously unseen home movies, personal photographs and family memorabilia are also included.
link.title: synopsis
Shemp Cocktail: A Toast to the Original Stooge: Disc 1
Shemp Cocktail: A Toast to the Original Stooge: Disc 2
The Three Stooges: Meet the Baron / Gold Raiders
The Three Stooges: Soup to Nuts
The Three Stooges: Kings of Laughter
Don't Touch That Dial: TV's Best Commercials
The Three Stooges: All the World's a Stooge
The Three Stooges: Swing Parade / Jerks of All Trades
The Three Stooges: Stooged and Confoosed
The Three Stooges: Lost Comedy Treasures
The Three Stooges: Three Stooges in History
The Three Stooges: Goofs on the Loose
The Three Stooges: All Time Favorites
Kings of Comedy: Masters of the Silent Screen
The Laurel & Hardy Collection: Vol. 2: Alone and Together
The Best of Abbott and Costello: Vol. 4
Martin & Lewis: At War with the Army
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: You Can't Cheat an Honest Man
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: My Little Chickadee
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: International House
The Three Stooges 75th Anniversary Edition: Tales from the Three Stooges Vol. 1

title.regular: Shemp Cocktail: A Toast to the Original Stooge
title.short: A Toast to the Original Stooge

link.synopsis: Filmmakers Ming Zhao and Gong Yan's An Orphan on the Streets centers on a homeless boy who's taken in by a lonely high-class woman. Lin Zuo's The Watch follows three homeless kids who find trouble when they steal a watch from an elderly vendor. Zhao and Yan's comedy stars Wongji Lang as the street urchin known as Three Hairs. The Watch is based on a short story by acclaimed author Xun Lu about a timepiece that changes lives as it changes hands.
link.title: synopsis
Listen to Britain and Other Films by Humphrey Jennings
The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes
Love Affair, or The Case of the Missing Switchboard Operator
Myriad of Lights / Along the Sungari River
Empress Wu Zetian / Dream of the Red Chamber
Coleccion Pedro Infante: Ustedes Los Ricos
Coleccion Pedro Infante: Nosotros Los Pobres
A Woman, a Gun and a Noodle Shop

title.regular: An Orphan on the Streets / The Watch
title.short: An Orphan on the Streets / The Watch

link.synopsis: Silvia and Adolfo can't wait to throw a big bash for their daughter Paty's 15th birthday, but the teen is afraid her fashionable friends won't think a quinceañera is cool. So she makes plans to ditch the party and hang out with her pals instead. But the evening doesn't turn out quite the way she intends. Ilean Almaguer, Carmen Madrid, Mario Zaragoza, Olmo Araiza and Rene Campero star in this Spanish-language comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Life of Ryan: The Complete Series

link.synopsis: Ice cream vendor Tikyo (Andy Bais) has no problem making other people happy, but he can't be happy himself until he reunites with his long-lost mother (Caridad Sanchez). After falling in love with the beautiful Sarah (Darling Lavina), Tikyo struggles to decide which woman is more important. Peppered with amusing characters and wonderful songs, this musical comedy from the Philippines is sure to entertain.
link.title: synopsis
Roadtrip Goes to Hong Kong and Beijing
Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote
Enteng Kabisote 3: Okay Ka Fairy Ko
All About Love: Ang Sarap Ma-In Love

link.synopsis: Believing they're about to inherit a fortune from their recently deceased uncle, Jack (Sharon Cuneta) and Jill (Herbert Bautista) sell their Jeepney and head for the United States. But then, their uncle's lawyer is killed right in front of them, and suddenly, the pair is on the run. Unsure who's out to get them or where they should go, Jack and Jill do their best to stay ahead of their pursuers in this sequel to the Filipino comedy Jack and Jill.
link.title: synopsis
Celebrate Special Occasions: The Best Recipes of Via Mare
Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote
Enteng Kabisote 3: Okay Ka Fairy Ko
All About Love: Ang Sarap Ma-In Love

link.synopsis: Inday (Maricel Soriano) has her world turned upside down when she learns from a tiyanak that she was actually adopted. After receiving this information, Inday sets out to find her biological mother (Susan Roces) and father (Eddie Gutierrez) and learn everything she can about her real family. But nothing can prepare her for the journey ahead in this fantastical comedy from the Philippines.
link.title: synopsis
Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote
Enteng Kabisote 3: Okay Ka Fairy Ko
All About Love: Ang Sarap Ma-In Love

link.synopsis: In this collection of interviews from 1979 to 1981, popular late-night talk show host Tom Snyder opens his interview couch up to groovy 1960s icons Dr. Timothy Leary, authors Tom Wolfe and Ken Kesey and the Grateful Dead, who also perform four songs. Wolfe discusses his novel The Right Stuff in his 1979 interview; Timothy Leary's 1981 interview coincides with his brief run as a "stand-up philosopher" at a New York comedy club.
link.title: synopsis
The Tomorrow Show with Tom Snyder: Punk & New Wave
The Tomorrow Show with Tom Snyder: John, Paul, Tom & Ringo
The Dick Cavett Show: John & Yoko Collection
The Dick Cavett Show: Rock Icons
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Dan Aykroyd
The Dick Cavett Show: Comic Legends
Gonzo: The Life and Work of Dr. Hunter S. Thompson
Fred Sokolow: Music of the Grateful Dead
The Skulls: Night of the Living Skulls
The Dick Cavett Show: Ray Charles Collection
The Night James Brown Saved Boston
Angels / Getting into Heaven: Double Feature
Tedeum / Revenge of Trinty / Viva Django / Blackie the Pirate
The Best Moments of the Amazing Kreskin
Larry King Live: Greatest Interviews Collection
Jerry Springer: Undressed, Unleashed, Uncensored!: Vol. 2
The Oprah Winfrey Show: 20th Anniversary Collection
Saturday Night Live: Live from New York: The First 5 Years
Louis Armstrong: The Louis Armstrong Show
Mitzi Gaynor: Razzle Dazzle! The Special Years
Inside the Actors Studio: Barbra Streisand
The Carol Burnett Show: Let's Bump Up the Lights!
Later... with Jools Holland: Cool Britannia
In the House with Peter Bart & Peter Guber
The Carol Burnett Show: Show Stoppers
Jerry Lee Lewis: The Jerry Lee Lewis Show
Graffiti Rock and Other Hip Hop Delights
The Best of So Graham Norton

title.regular: The Tomorrow Show: Tom Snyder's Electric Kool-Aid Talk Show
title.short: Tom Snyder's Electric Kool-Aid Talk Show

link.synopsis: At a junkyard in Butcher's Mill, Ill., lovable losers Buddy and Earl (Lance Barber and Billie Worley) cook up a scheme to kidnap a congressman (Chevy Chase). But when the politician has an accident at the local meatpacking plant, their plan turns rotten fast. High jinks abound in this crazy cult comedy written and directed by Scott Dikkers, the editor in chief of The Onion humor magazine. Judah Friedlander ("30 Rock") co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
Wicked Intentions: Hellinger / The Night Owl
The Return of Dracula / The Vampire
Jack and the Beanstalk: The Real Story
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home

link.synopsis: Three sailors (Tony Martin, Vic Damone and Russ Tamblyn) spend their shore leave romancing beautiful women in this bouncy musical comedy. When not chasing girls, the guys evade the dim-witted shore patrol (Alan King and Henry Slate) and the watchful eye of their stern admiral (Walter Pidgeon). The infectious songs include "I Know That You Know," "Hallelujah" and "Sometimes I'm Happy." Ann Miller, Jane Powell and Debbie Reynolds co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Dr. Seuss's The 5,000 Fingers of Dr. T
Seven Brides for Seven Brothers: 50th Anniversary Edition
The Teahouse of the August Moon
By the Light of the Silvery Moon

link.synopsis: Fresh off the heels of his "Queer Eye for the Straight Guy" makeover, rising star comedian Kevin Downey Jr. applies his wicked wit to such wide-ranging subjects as Martha Stewart and the Amish in this hilarious stand-up set. Filmed live at the swanky M Bar in Hollywood, this laugh-tastic evening comes courtesy of the Comedy Express tour. Don't miss the special interview with the New York-based comic.
link.title: synopsis
Chris & John to the Rescue: Season 1
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Lisa Lampanelli: Long Live the Queen
Ron White: You Can't Fix Stupid
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay
I Hope They Serve Beer in Hell
Karen Williams: I Need a Snack
George Carlin: It's Bad for Ya
Dana Gould: Let Me Put My Thoughts In You
Jackie "The Joke Man" Martling: A Safe Distance From Genius
Russell Peters: Red, White and Brown
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Jo Koy: Don't Make Him Angry
Mike Epps: Under Rated & Never Faded
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Christopher Titus: The 5th Annual End of the World Tour
Bobby Slayton: Born to Be Bobby
Greg Behrendt: Is That Guy from That Thing

title.regular: Kevin Downey Jr.: I'm Not Gay, But Don't Stop
title.short: I'm Not Gay, But Don't Stop

link.synopsis: This horror comedy spoof takes place at a sorority house, where the girls are planning to enjoy a long weekend of wild partying and feasting on the cuisine of their house's strange new chef -- until some of the coeds start to disappear. The remaining sisters, including the Slut, the Dumb Hot Blonde and the Bible Beater, must band together to survive a culinary-themed nightmare filled with nudity and gore.
link.title: synopsis
The Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Beginning

link.synopsis: Once a popular destination, the Lorraine Hotel in the Catskill Mountains is now old and in need of serious repair. As she considers closing up for good, hotel owner Lillian Garber (Maureen Stapleton) is determined to make this (possibly last) season memorable. Friendships and relationships between hotel staff members take center stage in this warm comedy, which also stars Trini Alvarado and Giancarlo Esposito.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: When he nobly stands up for a laid-off co-worker, Shinji Okajima (Tokihiko Okada) is fired and denied his year-end bonus. The repercussions come quickly when his stay-at-home wife (Emiko Yagumo) and children absorb the news in this affectionate family comedy. Clever slapstick and heartrending drama combine with exquisite results in this early work from acclaimed Japanese director Yasujiro Ozu.
link.title: synopsis
When a Woman Ascends the Stairs
Homicide: Life on the Street: Season 4
Late Ozu: The End of Summer
The Glamorous Life of Sachiko Hanai

link.synopsis: Still living at home with his big Italian-American family, Joey (Vincent Pagano) runs into former classmate and cancer survivor Mary (Marley Shelton), who attributes her recovery to a miracle. Joey finds himself slowly attracted to Mary -- and her beliefs. Director James Quattrochi's likable indie romantic comedy, written by Pagano, boasts an impressive supporting cast including Olympia Dukakis, Jennifer Esposito, Stacy Keach and Tess Harper.
link.title: synopsis
Belle and the Beast: A Christian Romance

link.synopsis: Best friends Trey and Chris are torn apart when they both fall in love with Camille, a beautiful stripper with her own agenda. When she chooses Trey, Chris is driven crazy with jealousy and cooks up a plan to drive the couple apart. But after Camille catches on to his plot, she starts to wonder whether she made the right choice in this comedy starring Brandi Micheals, Chudi Chinweze and Ryan Mitchell.
link.title: synopsis
What Kind of Love Is This?
You're Going to Make Me Love Somebody Else
A Good Day to Be Black & Sexy
Tyler Perry's The Family That Preys
A Good Man Is Hard to Find
Three Ways to Get a Husband
Amour Infinity: A Brooklyn Love Story

link.synopsis: Get ready for another riotous go-round of lying, stealing and "mix up and blender" in this follow-up to the roots play "Passa Passa." Picking up four years after the original story, the play chronicles a group of colorful characters at Mix-Up Plaza. At the center of the comedy are Frank, his wacky family and the wig-adorned Chu Chu. The laughs come fast and furious as audience members interact with the stars for a uniquely comic experience.
link.title: synopsis
There's a Stranger in My House
Three Ways to Get a Husband
If the Shoe Fits Wear It
Kiss and Tail: The Hollywood Jump-Off
Why We Laugh: Black Comedians on Black Comedy
Comedy Express: B.T.: I'm Not Black Enough
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam: Live from South Beach
Black Woman's Guide to Getting Married
I Think I Love My Wife
I Wish I Had a House Like This
Black Woman's Guide to Finding a Good Man

link.synopsis: A year after being the big man on campus with high hopes of a TV career, Russ Turner (Ross Kidder) finds himself broke, living at home and working as a janitor. While chasing his high school crush, Tara (Amelia Morck), Russ looks desperately for a way out of his dead-end life. And although his beer-swilling townie pals are fun, they aren't much for career advice in this raunchy comedy by writer-director Joe Kingsley.
link.title: synopsis
American Pie Presents: The Book of Love
National Lampoon Presents: One, Two, Many
Win a Date with Tad Hamilton!
The Dukes of Hazzard: The Beginning

link.synopsis: A struggling screenwriter (Andreas Wilson) gets something to write about when he joins a loony woman (Lolita Davidovich) on her way to kill her celebrity shrink at a Las Vegas book signing. Also in the mix are the doctor's other patients, including a hapless mobster (Fares Fares) and a suicidal transvestite (Alexander Skarsgård). Co-writer and director Björne Larson based his zany multicharacter comedy on actual events from his life.
link.title: synopsis
Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
Aqua Teen Hunger Force Colon Movie Film for Theaters
The Glamorous Life of Sachiko Hanai

link.synopsis: Directed by Michael Todd Kuskin, this rollicking indie comedy chronicles the high-spirited fun at a wild weekend shindig thrown by well-heeled high schooler Jacob Meyers (Kristian Kordula). Hormones rage out of control as Benjamin (Beau Allulli) tries to bed his reluctant girlfriend, Marty summons his courage to pursue his dream girl (Elizabeth G. Wilson), and the geeks turn up looking to change their image.
link.title: synopsis
American Pie Presents: The Naked Mile
American Pie Presents: The Book of Love
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th
House Party 4: Down to the Last Minute

link.synopsis: Opportunity knocks for aspiring novelist Gene Maxwell (Benjamin Ratner) when his ex-fiancée, B-movie star Liz Woodward (Elizabeth Berkley), needs Gene to help move her daft father (John Neville) into new digs before she heads to Europe for an acting gig. If Gene succeeds at the deceptively difficult task, he may just win back Liz in this genial indie comedy set in Vancouver, B.C. Jay Brazeau and Babs Chula play Gene's squabbling parents.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Determined to make it big in the New York City art world -- and to live an unconventional life -- 22-year-old Sarabeth Cohen (Marla Sokoloff) can't shake the influence of her domineering Jewish-American parents (Ronald Guttman and Tovah Feldshuh). But as Sarabeth's family starts to come apart at the seams, she's forced to make a tough choice in director Debra Kirschner's witty indie comedy. Rob McElhenney plays Sarabeth's gentile boyfriend.
link.title: synopsis
Bang the Drum Slowly / The Battler
The Private Lives of Pippa Lee
A Love Song for Bobby Long
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: One for the Road
Me and You and Everyone We Know

link.synopsis: This French surrealist, hyper-stylized comedy reveals what happens when an animal handler gets sucked into the world of two subversive, drug-addicted zookeepers in the midst of orchestrating a plot to kidnap a rich woman's dog. Everything goes awry when the three dognappers, in their efforts to wrangle the canine, find themselves forced into helping the dog's wealthy owner to achieve her last wish.
link.title: synopsis
Best of TromaDance Film Festival: Vol. 1
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single

link.synopsis: When the devotees and family of a master Japanese storyteller fulfill his particularly bawdy dying wish, they get more than they bargained for -- and a series of very wakeful nights ensues. Both provocative and wildly entertaining, this raucous and racy comedy celebrates the traditional Japanese mode of storytelling known as rakugo.
link.title: synopsis
Kal Ho Naa Ho: Tomorrow May Never Come
The Glamorous Life of Sachiko Hanai
Warm Water Under a Red Bridge

link.synopsis: When rustic farmer Gopi (Jeetendra) visits a lawyer's home, he's mistaken for Anand, a wealthy attorney who's engaged to the lawyer's beautiful daughter. When the real Anand shows up, the two discover they could be twins and agree to switch places. Will true love win out once the truth is revealed? Or have they sown the seeds of ruin for them both? Directed by Ravikant Nagaich, this entertaining comedy stars Komal, Mumtaz and Aruna Irani.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: John Melendez, best known as Stuttering John from "The Howard Stern Show" and announcer for "The Tonight Show with Jay Leno," stars as Thomas, a man searching for the perfect woman, that is to say, a woman who will consent to a threesome. Presented by National Lampoon, the outrageous comedy co-stars Bellamy Young, Hudson Leick, comic Jeffrey Ross and the great Jim J. Bullock. Melendez also wrote and produced.
link.title: synopsis
National Lampoon Presents: The Beach Party at the Threshold of Hell
National Lampoon's Ratko: The Dictator's Son
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
Can I Do It ... Til I Need Glasses?
Lost Reality 2: More of the Worst
National Lampoon Presents Jake's Booty Call

title.regular: National Lampoon Presents: One, Two, Many
title.short: National Lampoon Presents: One, Two, Many

link.synopsis: Screenwriter Ian Gurvitz also directs this independent dramatic comedy about six friends (Anthony Michael Hall, Dave Foley, Kevin Rahm, Sean Maguire, Nicholas D'Agosto and William Ragsdale) who routinely gather at a Hollywood blues bar to grumble about their problems. They've survived divorce, alcoholism and addictions to gambling. But the real mystery is how one of them ended up on a gurney as the result of an apparent suicide attempt.
link.title: synopsis
It's Kind of a Funny Story

link.synopsis: A young techie discovers the ethical perils of promotion to midlevel management in this 2007 indie comedy from director Dan Cohen. After spending time in the trenches as his company's technical whiz, Ted (Breckin Meyer) gets kicked upstairs to a position that includes all the perks: prestige, more money and … expensive call girls. Will family man Ted lose his moral compass, or will his success cost him everything he values in life?
link.title: synopsis
The Good, the Bad and the Beautiful / The Bikini Academy
Confessions of a Sociopathic Social Climber
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down

link.synopsis: Teenage best pals Judy (Jane Powell) and Carol (Elizabeth Taylor) find their friendship put to the test when they both fall for the same suave fellow (Robert Stack) in this breezy musical comedy. Meanwhile, Judy's on a sleuthing mission to find out if her father (Wallace Beery) is having an affair with a gorgeous rumba dancer (Carmen Miranda). Legendary bandleader Xavier Cougat and his ensemble make an appearance at the high school dance.
link.title: synopsis
The Doctor Takes a Wife / A Night to Remember
Take Me Out to the Ball Game
Deanna Durbin: Three Smart Girls / Something in the Wind

link.synopsis: After fleeing to New York City to escape her rigid Amish father, aspiring dancer Rachel Schpitendavel (Britt Ekland) lands a job at Minsky's Burlesque House, where she captures the hearts of a comic (Jason Robards) and his partner (Norman Wisdom). Meanwhile, a moral crusader (Denholm Elliott) is making life tough for the club owner (Elliott Gould). Fine performances punctuate this bawdy comedy also starring Bert Lahr (in his final role).
link.title: synopsis
A Big Hand for the Little Lady
Harry and Walter Go to New York
The Man with the Golden Gun
Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie

link.synopsis: Directed by Antonio Mercero, this 2003 comedy (based on real-life events) follows cancer-ward residents Miguel Angel (Juan José Ballesta) and his trio of teenage friends -- who are always up to mischief. Despite their grave conditions, the four youngsters play roundball in their wheelchairs, chase skirts and pull pranks on the hospital staff. The cast also includes Luis Ángel Priego, Gorka Moreno, Alejandro Zafra and Marco Martínez.
link.title: synopsis
The Other Side of the Bed
R2: Y el Caso del Cadaver Sin Cabeza

link.synopsis: When the British Space Agency creates a revolutionary new space buggy, a team of con artists reunites to take a crack at the ultimate scam in this family-friendly comedy. Will Spencer (Martin Kemp) and his partner in crime, Tom Marks (Chris Barrie), are joined by Will's niece and Tom's screwball son in a foolproof plan to sell the technology to international buyers. Only one thing stands in their way: Scotland Yard's dopiest detective!
link.title: synopsis
The Shadow of the Tower: The Rise of the Tudor Dynasty
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People

link.synopsis: Writer-director Skip Usen's lighthearted comedy centers on a quirky Jewish clan coming to terms with the death of the family's beloved matriarch -- and her senile husband Sol's (Fyvush Finkel) insistence to keep her ashes by his side at all times. Stanley Kamel, Armin Shimerman  Irwin Keyes, Rosalee Mayeux and Greg Zola fill out the impressive cast of this madcap family farce.
link.title: synopsis
If You Could Only Cook / Too Many Husbands
My Sister Eileen / She Wouldn't Say Yes
No Time for Love / The Egg and I
The Doctor Takes a Wife / A Night to Remember

link.synopsis: Facing failing marriages and financial ruin when their business venture tanks, friends and entrepreneurs Steve (William Mapother) and Harry (Daniel Baldwin) turn to an unlikely source to bring them back from the brink -- cows! But will this dubious last-ditch effort put them in the black? Directed by "Happy Days" co-star Don Most, this outrageous comedy -- based on true events -- also features Treat Williams, Charlotte Ross and Efren Ramirez.
link.title: synopsis
Bob Ross: The Joy of Painting: Seascape Collection

link.synopsis: Richard Pryor delivers a masterful performance as a prisoner of war who returns home from Vietnam only to find his civilian life in shambles. Broke and despondent, will he turn to a life of crime, or can a hooker with a heart of gold (Margot Kidder) persuade him to stay on the straight and narrow? Deftly blending drama and Pryor's gift for comedy, this engaging yarn also stars Ronny Cox, Lynne Moody and Ray Sharkey.
link.title: synopsis
Richard Pryor: I Ain't Dead Yet #*%$#@!! Uncensored
See No Evil, Hear No Evil
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip
Jo Jo Dancer, Your Life is Calling
Quackser Fortune Has a Cousin in the Bronx
Born on the Fourth of July

link.synopsis: Andy Schmidt (Henry Winkler) is literally a starving actor when he meets a wrestling promoter (Gene Saks) who gives him a chance to put some food on the table by transforming him into a flashy pro wrestler dubbed "the One and Only." Soon enough, Andy's career in the ring takes off. But his private life with his wife (Kim Darby) is on the rocks. Hervé Villechaize ("Fantasy Island") co-stars in this romantic comedy from director Carl Reiner.
link.title: synopsis
Bowanga Bowanga / Wild Women of Wongo / Virgin Sacrifice
Pro Wrestling's Ultimate Insiders: Last Call with Raven & Sandman
The Best of RVD TV: Vol. 1

link.synopsis: Neve Campbell stars as a waitress in this comedy about five women working dead-end jobs in a London restaurant while they nurture their alter identities as a writer, an artist, an actor, a lover and a revolutionary. But before they can realize their dreams, they have to make it through the next shift. Oana Pellea, Anna Maxwell Martin, Shirley Henderson and Alexandra Maria Lara co-star in director Oliver Parker's ensemble film.
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in the Midlands
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
Monty Python and the Holy Grail
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels

link.synopsis: Nerds Patty Greene (Sarah Jessica Parker, in an early starring role) and Lauren Hutchinson (Amy Linker) start high school determined to fit in with the cool crowd, but the geeky duo soon discovers that becoming popular might be the hardest lesson to master. Both poignant and laugh-out-loud funny, the classic 1980s comedy series features guest appearances by Bill Murray, Martin Mull and other famous comedians.
link.title: synopsis
Square Pegs: The Complete Series: Disc 1
Square Pegs: The Complete Series: Disc 2
Square Pegs: The Complete Series: Disc 3
One Day at a Time: Season 1
Daria: The Movie: Is It Fall Yet?
Mystery Science Theater 3000: I Accuse My Parents
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
Not On Your Nellie: The Complete First Series

link.synopsis: In this farcical comedy, unhappily married Val (Deborah Kerr) and Dan (Frank Sinatra) take a second honeymoon in Mexico, where they accidentally get a divorce. When Dan is called away, his best friend, Ernie (Dean Martin), comes to look after Val, and the two of them mistakenly get married. In order to teach Dan a lesson, Val refuses to get another divorce, and Ernie admits that he's always had strong feelings for Val.
link.title: synopsis
How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life / Who Was That Lady?
My Friend Irma / My Friend Irma Goes West
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!

link.synopsis: A business trip turns into an earth-shattering experience for Ashok (Sanjeev Kumar) and his servant Bahadur (Deven Verma), when after being mistakenly identified by one stranger after the next, the pair learns that they both have identical twin brothers they never knew. Based on Shakespeare's "The Comedy of Errors," this lighthearted tale is written and directed by filmmaker Sampooran Singh Gulzar.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Writer-directors Peter and Bobby Farrelly built their careers on slapstick comedy and gross-out humor. But, as this in-depth interview reveals, one of the secrets of their success is that their films are ultimately anchored by a sweet love story. The brothers talk about other tricks of the trade, including how to surprise the audience, in this installment of the series that trains the lens on Hollywood's top screenwriters.
link.title: synopsis
The Dialogue: An Interview with Screenwriter John Hamburg
The Dialogue: An Interview with Screenwriter Callie Khouri
The Ascent of Money: The Financial History of the World
The Dialogue: Lowell Ganz and Babaloo Mandel
The Dialogue: An Interview with Screenwriter Nia Vardalos
The Dialogue: An Interview with Screenwriter Billy Ray
The Dialogue: An Interview with Screenwriter Nick Kazan
Gordon B. Hinckley: Honoring the Life and Legacy of a Prophet
Great Railroad Adventures: British Rail Journeys: Vol. 1
The Speeches Collection: Vol. 2: Republicans vs. Democrats
All Aboard! American Train Journeys: Vol. 2
All Aboard! American Train Journeys: Vol. 1
Here Is Always Somewhere Else: The Disappearance of Bas Jan Ader
1000 Places to See Before You Die: Collection 2
Moon Race: The History of Apollo: Vol. 2
Popular Mechanics: The New Technology of War
Moon Race: The History of Apollo: Vol. 1
Wounded Heart: Pine Ridge and the Sioux

title.regular: The Dialogue: Bobby and Peter Farrelly
title.short: The Dialogue: Bobby and Peter Farrelly

link.synopsis: Assigned to demolish an old textile factory, Osvaldo Lazzari (Jorge Paccini) discovers the condemned building is occupied by the delusional Beto Luna (Enrique Liporace), a longtime employee who thinks he can still revive the company. Unfortunately for Osvaldo, his desperate attempts to get Beto to leave come up against the unexpected power of the loopy man's imagination. Marcelo Mangone directs this charming Argentinean comedy.
link.title: synopsis
No Dejare Que No Me Quieras
I Don't Know What Your Eyes Have Done to Me

link.synopsis: Hoping to buy a house, grocery store assistant manager Doug (Seann William Scott) applies for a manager position at his chain's new location. Doug feels confident about getting hired until recent arrival Richard (John C. Reilly) applies for the same job. In order to secure the coveted promotion, the competing employees go head-to-head in minor battles, often resorting to cruel behavior in this indie comedy directed by Steve Conrad.
link.title: synopsis
Balls Out: Gary the Tennis Coach
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
The Goods: Live Hard, Sell Hard

link.synopsis: Thomas Lindsey (Jeff Clark) signs away his entire life's savings in a pyramid scheme, which involves selling a miracle drug that claims to cure numerous ailments. While trying to hide his money problems from his wife, Thomas searches desperately for customers. Jake Mahaffy writes, directs, produces, shoots and edits this low-budget comedy, which won the Grand Jury Prize at the South by Southwest Festival in 2008.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
A Collection of 2007 Academy Award Nominated Short Films

link.synopsis: In wartime London, smooth-talking draft dodger Eric Trapp (Robson Green) and stalwart British pilot Eddie Wallis (Jerome Flynn) have only one thing in common: they both play in the same band. But a series of skirmishes with gangsters, spies and bombers is about to change all that. Joining forces for the greater good, the two vow to defend England … using all the lying and cheating means at their disposal in this fast-paced comedy drama.
link.title: synopsis
Mr. Palfrey of Westminster: The Complete Series
The Catherine Cookson Collection: The Gambling Man
The Rutles 2: Can't Buy Me Lunch
A Dance to the Music of Time
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels

link.synopsis: This interpretation of Shakespeare's best-loved romantic comedy follows the story of Hermia (Monica Dolan), a young woman of high station who must choose either to agree to an arranged marriage by her father or rebel against her family to be with her true love. Meanwhile, the mischievous fairies who live in the forest decide to have some fun with this romantic plight among mortals and use magic to create -- and repair -- misunderstandings.
link.title: synopsis
Shakespeare Comedies: A Midsummer Night's Dream
The Complete Works of William Shakespeare (Abridged)
Shakespeare Comedies: As You Like It

link.synopsis: Two of Maxwell Smart's brilliant but nerdy fellow analysts -- CONTROL technician Bruce (Masi Oka) and his geeky buddy Lloyd (Nate Torrence) -- are showcased in this spin-off of the Get Smart movie, which was inspired by the classic television sitcom.The eccentric duo's escapades and misadventures continue as they work diligently to thwart the evil agents at KAOS. Jayma Mays and Marika Dominczyk also star in this action-packed comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2
The Man with One Red Shoe
Harry Knuckles and the Pearl Necklace

title.regular: Get Smart's Bruce & Lloyd Out of Control

link.synopsis: This brutally honest comedy depicts the Jewish-Italian wedding reception of Lisa Weinstein (Deborah Gibson), as guests can't help but notice the romantic sparks among Lisa, the groom (Joey Scherr), the maid of honor (Mo Gaffney) and the bride's ex-boyfriend, the reception band leader (Martin Guigui). Meanwhile, various guests on both sides of the aisle pursue their own love interests at the event. Dom DeLuise co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
Benny Bliss & the Disciples of Greatness
Rey Mysterio: The Biggest Little Man
The Awful Truth with Michael Moore
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home
Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human
Smiling Fish and Goat on Fire

link.synopsis: Hoping to use the occasion to ask his boss for a raise, Pritam's plans for a perfect dinner party go down the drain when his wife up and leaves. The only solution: beg his buddy to allow his beautiful girlfriend to pose as his wife. But even the best-laid plans fail when Pritam's real wife resurfaces in the middle of the party and his boss demands the truth. Mukesh Rawal stars in this comedy of errors from director Hanif Mohammad.
link.title: synopsis
Lakhtar Ni Ladi Ne Vilayat No Var
Som Thi Shukra Taro, Shaniware Hun Maro

link.synopsis: No matter how anxious his family is for him to marry, Maniya isn't ready to give up the single life. So when he finds himself backed into an impending wedding, will he give in to the nuptials or find a way to preserve his bachelorhood? Sharad Sharma, Jaideep Shah, Chitrak Bhatt, Jyotika Shah and Kalpana Diwan star in this charming comedy from filmmaker Darshan Jariwala.
link.title: synopsis
Som Thi Shukra Taro, Shaniware Hun Maro
Lakhtar Ni Ladi Ne Vilayat No Var
